title: Executive Order to Censor Smithsonian Museums - Erase 'Divisive' History
summary: Trump signed Executive Order 14253 'Restoring Truth and Sanity to American History' targeting Smithsonian museums. Order prohibits exhibits that 'degrade shared American values, divide Americans based on race, or promote programs inconsistent with Federal law.' Specifically targets American Art Museum and National Museum of African American History and Culture for portraying 'American and Western values as inherently harmful.' Bans Women's History Museum from exhibits celebrating trans women. Order attempts government censorship of independent museums documenting accurate history. Closes Office of Diversity, freezes hiring. Attempts to erase racism from US history.
keyFacts: March 27, 2025: Trump signed Executive Order 14253 'Restoring Truth and Sanity to American History'
Order removes 'divisive, race-centered ideology' from Smithsonian museums, research centers, and National Zoo
Prohibits exhibits that 'degrade shared American values, divide Americans based on race'
Specifically targets American Art Museum and National Museum of African American History and Culture
Order claims these museums promote 'narratives that portray American and Western values as inherently harmful and oppressive'
Bans Women's History Museum from hosting exhibits that celebrate trans women
Directs VP Vance to eliminate 'divisive race-centered ideology' from Smithsonian institutions
Smithsonian announced freeze on federal hiring and closure of Office of Diversity following order
Legal questions: Smithsonian's structure outside three branches arguably makes it not subject to executive orders
Critics: Order attempts to 'erase racism from U.S. history' and sanitize uncomfortable truths
Order labels accurate historical documentation as 'improper ideology'
Part of broader pattern: Philadelphia slavery exhibit removal, 1776 Commission revival, CRT bans
This is government censorship of museums documenting factual American history
